name: Juvenile Recurrent Parotitis
chief_complaint: My child's cheek keeps swelling up and it hurts
symptoms: Recurrent unilateral or bilateral parotid gland swelling
physical_findings: Mild erythema over the affected area
prognosis: Generally good; most cases resolve spontaneously by puberty, though some may persist into adulthood
description: Juvenile Recurrent Parotitis is an inflammatory condition of the parotid gland characterized by recurrent episodes of swelling and pain. It is the second most common cause of parotid swelling in children after mumps. The exact etiology is unknown but may involve ductal abnormalities, genetic factors, or autoimmune components.
